page.title: 10Clearing the Canal to Ripon.
page.content: The{Ripon Canal Society}are trying to clear the canal so that boats can cruise to the middle of{Ripon.}A mechanical digger is being used to clear lots of rubbish, from bottles to large rocks. The major problem concerning the reopening of the canal in the area covered by this survey is that of re-positioning the route of two pipes. These cross the canal and are both about one metre above water level. Such alterations require careful planning and financial backing. The Ripon Canal Society is constantly looking for ways to raise money for such ventures. At the present time, it is collecting aluminium cans which will be sold to a scrap metal dealer for a good price.
